Column Comment.0: PROJECT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the project.
Column Comment.1: EQUIPMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the equipment that isused in the project. Note that an obs no was used because the relationship may be toa real piece of equipment (EQUIPMENT) or a type of equipment (CAT EQUIPMENT).Please populate the appropriate foreign keys.
Column Comment.2: REFERENCE PROJECT EQUIPMENT ROLE: the role played by a piece ofequipment in a project, such as pumper, saftey equipment, processor, primarystorage device etc. Tthe SEQ NO component allows these values to be sequenced.
Column Comment.3: ROLE SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique identifier added to allow a businessassociate to play the same role in a project more than once over its lifetime.
Column Comment.4: STEP ID: Unique identifier for the project step.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.8: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium. In this case, thebusiness associate who operated the equipment in fulfilment of this role.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: narrative comments about the Business Associate role in the, such asdescriptive qualifiers.
Column Comment.11: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
